yacx

Class PaddingArg

  • java.lang.Object
    • yacx.JNIHandle
      • yacx.KernelArg
        • yacx.ArrayArg
          • yacx.PaddingArg

  • public class PaddingArg
extends ArrayArg
    Class representing an argument for the kernel.
    This argument containing an ArrayArg with a specific padding.

    • Method Detail

      • createMatrixPadding

        public static PaddingArg createMatrixPadding(ArrayArg arg,
                                             int rowsArg,
                                             int columnsArg,
                                             int rowsNew,
                                             int columnsNew,
                                             int paddingValue)
        Creates a new PaddingArg with the passed ArrayArg interpreting the array as matrix.
        When uploaded, the PaddingArg create a new array (interpreting as matrix) on the device with passed values for dimensions using the values from ArrayArg and paddingValue to fill up remaining values.
        if isDownload is true: after kernellaunch the result will be downloaded to the passed ArrayArg (without the padding).
        Only supports arrays with elementsize 1, 2 or 4 bytes.
        Parameters:
        arg - ArrayArg
        rowsArg - number of rows in the matrix arg
        columnsArg - number of columns in the matrix arg
        rowsNew - new number of rows for the new matrix on the device
        columnsNew - new number of columns for the new matrix on the device
        paddingValue - value to fill up remaining for the new matrix
        Returns:
        new PaddingArg for the passed ArrayArg with specific padding on the device

      • getArg

        public ArrayArg getArg()
        Return original ArrayArg which is padded in this arg.
        Use this to access data from this PaddingArg.
        Returns:
        original ArrayArg

        Returns:

      • slice

        public ArrayArg slice(int start,
                      int end)
        Description copied from class: ArrayArg
        Slices the array.
        This creates a new ArrayArg corresponding to a new C-KernelArg-Object, but using the same memory for the array.
        If the content of this ArrayArg changed, the content of the created ArrayArg will be changed too. In the other direction as well.
        Specified by:
        slice in class ArrayArg
        Parameters:
        start - index of the first element for the new array
        end - index of the last element for new array
        Returns:
        a new ArrayArg using the same memory for the array

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from class: JNIHandle
        Delete corresponding C-Object.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class JNIHandle
